title: The Twitter Bitcoin Scam of 2020
description: A fast breakdown of The Twitter Bitcoin Scam of 2020 for builders.

hook.text: In July 2020, the Twitter accounts of Elon Musk, Obama, and Apple all tweeted: 'Send Bitcoin, get double back.'

buildup.text: Hackers had compromised Twitter's internal tools. They took over the biggest accounts on the platform simultaneously.

discovery.text: The scam collected about $120,000 in Bitcoin before Twitter shut it down. The damage could have been far worse.

twist.text: The mastermind was a 17-year-old from Florida. He had bribed a Twitter employee for access to internal admin tools.

climax.text: The attack embarrassed the world's largest social network. A teenager exposed its internal security as shockingly weak.

punchline.text: A teenager hacked Obama's Twitter to run a Bitcoin scam.

quiz.question: How did the 2020 Twitter Bitcoin scammers gain access?
options: They bribed an employee for access to internal admin tools
